member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIREFRESHMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to refresh the window menu of the MDI frame window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MDIRESTORE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIRESTORE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to restore an MDI child window from maximized or minimized size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MDISETMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDISETMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to replace the entire menu of an MDI frame window, to replace the window menu of the frame window, or both.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MDITILE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDITILE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all of its MDI child windows in a tile format.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MEASUREITEM
member.summary: Sent to the owner window of a combo box, list box, list-view control, or menu item when the control or menu is created.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MENUCHAR
member.summary: Sent when a menu is active and the user presses a key that does not correspond to any mnemonic or accelerator key. This message is sent to the window that owns the menu.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MENUSELECT
member.summary: Sent to a menu's owner window when the user selects a menu item.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOUSEACTIVATE
member.summary: Sent when the cursor is in an inactive window and the user presses a mouse button. The parent window receives this message only if the child window passes it to the DefWindowProc function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOUSEFIRST
member.summary: Specify the first mouse message.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOUSEHOVER
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the client area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOUSELAST
member.summary: Posted to a window to get the last mouse position.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOUSELEAVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor leaves the client area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor moves. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOUSEWHEEL
member.summary: Sent to the focus window when the mouse wheel is rotated. The DefWindowProc function propagates the message to the window's parent. There should be no internal forwarding of the message, since DefWindowProc propagates it up the parent chain until it finds a window that processes it.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOVE
member.summary: Sent after a window has been moved.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_MOVING
member.summary: Sent while window is in moving.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCACTIVATE
member.summary: Sent to a window when its non client area needs to be changed to indicate an active or inactive state.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCCALCSIZE
member.summary: Sent when the size and position of a window's client area must be calculated. By processing this message, an application can control the content of the window's client area when the size or position of the window changes.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCCREATE
member.summary: Sent prior to the WM_CREATE message when a window is first created.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCDESTROY
member.summary: Notifies a window that its non client area is being destroyed. The DestroyWindow function sends the WM_NCDESTROY message to the window following the WM_DESTROY message.WM_DESTROY is used to free the allocated memory object associated with the window. The WM_NCDESTROY message is sent after the child windows have been destroyed. In contrast, WM_DESTROY is sent before the child windows are destroyed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCHITTEST
member.summary: Sent to a window in order to determine what part of the window corresponds to a particular screen coordinate. This can happen, for example, when the cursor moves, when a mouse button is pressed or released, or in response to a call to a function such as WindowFromPoint. If the mouse is not captured, the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is sent to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCLBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCLBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCLBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCMBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCMBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCMBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCMOUSEHOVER
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the non-client area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCMOUSELEAVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor leaves the non-client area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCMOUSEMOVE
member.summary: Posted to a window when the cursor is moved within the non-client area of the window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCRBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCRBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NCRBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is within the non-client area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NEXTDLGCTL
member.summary: Sent to a dialog box procedure to set the keyboard focus to a different control in the dialog box.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NEXTMENU
member.summary: Sent to an application when the right or left arrow key is used to switch between the menu bar and the system menu.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NOTIFY
member.summary: Sent by a common control to its parent window when an event has occurred or the control requires some information.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NOTIFYFORMAT
member.summary: Determines if a window accepts ANSI or Unicode structures in the WM_NOTIFY notification message. WM_NOTIFYFORMAT messages are sent from a common control to its parent window and from the parent window to the common control.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_NULL
member.summary: Performs no operation. An application sends the WM_NULL message if it wants to post a message that the recipient window will ignore.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PALETTECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_PALETTECHANGED message is sent to all top-level and overlapped windows after the window with the keyboard focus has realized its logical palette, thereby changing the system palette. This message enables a window that uses a color palette but does not have the keyboard focus to realize its logical palette and update its client area.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PALETTEISCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_PALETTEISCHANGING message informs applications that an application is going to realize its logical palette.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Sent to a window when a significant action occurs on a descendant window. This message is now extended to include the WM_POINTERDOWN event. When the child window is being created, the system sends WM_PARENTNOTIFY just before the CreateWindow or CreateWindowEx function that creates the window returns. When the child window is being destroyed, the system sends the message before any processing to destroy the window takes place.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PASTE
member.summary: An application sends a WM_PASTE message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current content of the clipboard to the edit control at the current caret position. Data is inserted only if the clipboard contains data in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PENWINFIRST
member.summary: The pend that creates first for the drawing.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PENWINLAST
member.summary: The pend that creates last for the drawing.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_POWER
member.summary: Notifies applications that the system, typically a battery-powered personal computer, is about to enter a suspended mode.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_POWERBROADCAST
member.summary: Notifies applications that a power-management event has occurred.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PRINT
member.summary: The WM_PRINT message is sent to a window to request that it draw itself in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PRINTCLIENT
member.summary: The WM_PRINTCLIENT message is sent to a window to request that it draw its client area in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context. Unlike WM_PRINT, WM_PRINTCLIENT is not processed by DefWindowProc. A window should process the WM_PRINTCLIENT message through an application-defined WindowProc function for it to be used properly.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PSD_ENVSTAMPRECT
member.summary: Notifies the hook procedure of a Page Setup dialog box, PagePaintHook, that the dialog box is about to draw the envelope-stamp rectangle of the sample page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PSD_FULLPAGERECT
member.summary: Notifies a PagePaintHook hook procedure of the coordinates of the sample page rectangle in the Page Setup dialog box. The dialog box sends this message when it is about to draw the contents of the sample page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PSD_GREEKTEXTRECT
member.summary: Notifies the hook procedure of a Page Setup dialog box, PagePaintHook, that the dialog box is about to draw Greek text inside the margin rectangle of the sample page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PSD_MARGINRECT
member.summary: Notifies the hook procedure of a Page Setup dialog box, PagePaintHook, that the dialog box is about to draw the margin rectangle of the sample page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PSD_MINMARGINRECT
member.summary: Notifies a PagePaintHook hook procedure of the coordinates of the margin rectangle in the sample page. A Page Setup dialog box sends this message when it is about to draw the contents of the sample page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PSD_PAGESETUPDLG
member.summary: Notifies a PagePaintHook hook procedure that the Page Setup dialog box is about to draw the contents of the sample page. The hook procedure can use this message to carry out initialization tasks related to drawing the contents of the sample page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_PSD_YAFULLPAGERECT
member.summary: Notifies the hook procedure of a Page Setup dialog box, PagePaintHook, that the dialog box is about to draw the return address portion of an envelope sample page.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_QUERYDRAGICON
member.summary: Sent to a minimized (iconic) window. The window is about to be dragged by the user but does not have an icon defined for its class. An application can return a handle to an icon or cursor. The system displays this cursor or icon while the user drags the icon.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_QUERYENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_QUERYENDSESSION message is sent when the user chooses to end the session or when an application calls one of the system shutdown functions. If any application returns zero, the session is not ended. The system stops sending WM_QUERYENDSESSION messages as soon as one application returns zero. After processing this message, the system sends the WM_ENDSESSION message with the wParam parameter set to the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_QUERYNEWPALETTE
member.summary: The WM_QUERYNEWPALETTE message informs a window that it is about to receive the keyboard focus, giving the window the opportunity to realize its logical palette when it receives the focus.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_QUERYOPEN
member.summary: Sent to an icon when the user requests that the window be restored to its previous size and position.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_QUERYUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_QUERYUISTATE message to retrieve the UI state for a window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_QUEUESYNC
member.summary: Sent by a computer-based training (CBT) application to separate user-input messages from other messages sent through the WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK procedure.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_QUIT
member.summary: Indicates a request to terminate an application, and is generated when the application calls the PostQuitMessage function. This message causes the GetMessage function to return zero.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: Posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_RBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: Posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_RBUTTONUP
member.summary: Posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_RENDERALLFORMATS
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner before it is destroyed, if the clipboard owner has delayed rendering one or more clipboard formats. For the content of the clipboard to remain available to other applications, the clipboard owner must render data in all the formats it is capable of generating, and place the data on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_RENDERFORMAT
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner if it has delayed rendering a specific clipboard format and if an application has requested data in that format. The clipboard owner must render data in the specified format and place it on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SETCURSOR
member.summary: Sent to a window if the mouse causes the cursor to move within a window and mouse input is not captured.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SETFOCUS
member.summary: Sent to a window after it has gained the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SETFONT
member.summary: Sets the font that a control is to use when drawing text.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SETHOTKEY
member.summary: Sent to a window to associate a hot key with the window. When the user presses the hot key, the system activates the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SETICON
member.summary: Associates a new large or small icon with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog box, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SETTEXT
member.summary: Sets the text of a window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SETTINGCHANGE
member.summary: A message that is sent to all top-level windows when the SystemParametersInfo function changes a system-wide setting or when policy settings have changed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Sent to a window when the window is about to be hidden or shown.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SIZE
member.summary: Sent to a window after its size has changed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SIZECLIPBOARD
member.summary: Sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area has changed size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SIZING
member.summary: Sent to a window that the user is resizing. By processing this message, an application can monitor the size and position of the drag rectangle and, if needed, change its size or position.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SPOOLERSTATUS
member.summary: The WM_SPOOLERSTATUS message is sent from Print Manager whenever a job is added to or removed from the Print Manager queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_STYLECHANGED
member.summary: Sent to a window after the SetWindowLong function has changed one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_STYLECHANGING
member.summary: Sent to a window when the SetWindowLong function is about to change one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SYSCHAR
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. It specifies the character code of a system character key that is, a character key that is pressed while the ALT key is down.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_SYSCOLORCHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows when a change is made to a system color setting.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A window receives this message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu (formerly known as the system or control menu) or when the user chooses the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, or close button.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SYSDEADCHAR
member.summary: Sent to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_SYSDEADCHAR specifies the character code of a system dead key that is, a dead key that is pressed while holding down the ALT key.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_SYSKEYUP
member.summary: Posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_TCARD
member.summary: Sent to an application that has initiated a training card with Windows Help. The message informs the application when the user clicks an authorable button. An application initiates a training card by specifying the HELP_TCARD command in a call to the WinHelp function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_TIMECHANGE
member.summary: A message that is sent whenever there is a change in the system time.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_TIMER
member.summary: Posted to the installing thread's message queue when a timer expires. The message is posted by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_UNDO
member.summary: An application sends a WM_UNDO message to an edit control to undo the last operation. When this message is sent to an edit control, the previously deleted text is restored or the previously added text is deleted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_UPDATEUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_UPDATEUISTATE message to change the UI state for the specified window and all its child windows.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_USER
member.summary: Used to define private messages for use by private window classes, usually of the form WM_USER+x, where x is an integer value.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_USERCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to all windows after the user has logged on or off. When the user logs on or off, the system updates the user-specific settings. The system sends this message immediately after updating the settings.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_VKEYTOITEM
member.summary: Sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_KEYDOWN message.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order has changed as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING
member.summary: Sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order is about to change as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WM_WININICHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_WININICHANGE message to all top-level windows after making a change to the WIN.INI file. The SystemParametersInfo function sends this message after an application uses the function to change a setting in WIN.INI.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The windows is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: The window has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: The window is a MDI child window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: The window is intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: The title bar of the window includes a question mark. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: The window has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recursive into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: The window has a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the task-bar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: The window is a layered window. This style cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: The window should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: The window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the horizontal origin of the window is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_SIZE
member.summary: Sizes the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_MOVE
member.summary: Moves the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_CLOSE
member.summary: Closes the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_MOUSEMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a mouse click.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_KEYMENU
member.summary: Retrieves the window menu as a result of a keystroke. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_RESTORE
member.summary: Restores the window to its normal position and size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Changes the cursor to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a control in the dialog box, the control receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_DEFAULT
member.summary: Selects the default item; the user double-clicked the window menu.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SC_HOTKEY
member.summary: Activates the window associated with the application-specified hot key. The lParam parameter identifies the window to activate.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_ENABLEOK
member.summary: This message enables or disables the OK button for the Browse For Folder dialog box.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_SETSELECTION
member.summary: This message indicates that the selection in the dialog box changed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_SETSTATUSTEXTW
member.summary: This message sets the status text in the Browse For Folder dialog box.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_SETOKTEXT
member.summary: Sets the text that is displayed on the dialog box's OK button.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_SETEXPANDED
member.summary: Specifies the path of a folder to expand in the Browse dialog box. The path can be specified as a Unicode string or a PIDL.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_INITIALIZED
member.summary: The dialog box has finished initializing.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_SELCHANGED
member.summary: This message indicates that the selection in the dialog box changed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_VALIDATEFAILEDW
member.summary: The user typed an invalid name into the dialog's edit box. A nonexistent folder is considered an invalid name.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.BFFM_IUNKNOWN
member.summary: An IUnknown interface is available to the dialog box.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GW_HWNDFIRST
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window of the same type that is highest in the Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GW_HWNDLAST
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window of the same type that is lowest in the Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GW_HWNDNEXT
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window below the specified window in the Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GW_HWNDPREV
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the window above the specified window in the Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GW_OWNER
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the specified window's owner window, if any. For more information, see Owned Windows.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GW_CHILD
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the child window at the top of the Z order, if the specified window is a parent window; otherwise, the retrieved handle is NULL. The function examines only child windows of the specified window. It does not examine descendant windows.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GW_ENABLEDPOPUP
member.summary: The retrieved handle identifies the enabled popup window owned by the specified window (the search uses the first such window found using GW_HWNDNEXT); otherwise, if there are no enabled popup windows, the retrieved handle is that of the specified window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GWL_WNDPROC
member.summary: Sets a new address for the window procedure. You cannot change this attribute if the window does not belong to the same process as the calling thread.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GWL_HWNDPARENT
member.summary: Index to change the parent of a child window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GWL_STYLE
member.summary: Sets a new window style.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GWL_EXSTYLE
member.summary: Sets a new extended window style.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.GWL_ID
member.summary: Sets a new identifier of the child window. The window cannot be a top-level window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.CS_DROPSHADOW
member.summary: Enables the drop shadow effect on a window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SRCCOPY
member.summary: Copies the source rectangle directly to the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DCX_WINDOW
member.summary: Returns a DC that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DCX_CACHE
member.summary: Returns a DC from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DCX_INTERSECTRGN
member.summary: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE
member.summary: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DCX_PARENTCLIP
member.summary: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DCX_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DCX_EXCLUDERGN
member.summary: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.RGN_AND
member.summary: Creates the intersection of the two combined regions.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.RGN_OR
member.summary: Creates the union of two combined regions.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.RGN_XOR
member.summary: Creates the union of two combined regions except for any overlapping areas.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.RGN_DIFF
member.summary: Combines the parts of hrgnSrc1 that are not part of hrgnSrc2.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.RGN_COPY
member.summary: Creates a copy of the region identified by hrgnSrc1.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.EM_GETRECT
member.summary: Gets the formatting rectangle of an edit control.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.EM_CHARFROMPOS
member.summary: Gets information about the character closest to a specified point in the client area of an edit control.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_KEY
member.summary: A WM_KEYUP, WM_KEYDOWN, WM_SYSKEYUP, or WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is in the queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: A WM_MOUSEMOVE message is in Queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_MOUSEBUTTON
member.summary: A mouse-button message (WM_LBUTTONUP, WM_RBUTTONDOWN, and so on).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_POSTMESSAGE
member.summary: A posted message (other than those listed here) is in the queue.

member.summary: A WM_TIMER message is in the queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_PAINT
member.summary: A WM_PAINT message is in the queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_SENDMESSAGE
member.summary: A message sent by another thread or application is in the queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_HOTKEY
member.summary: A WM_HOTKEY message is in the queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_ALLPOSTMESSAGE
member.summary: A posted message (other than those listed here) is in the queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_RAWINPUT
member.summary: A raw input message is in the queue. For more information, see Raw Input.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_MOUSE
member.summary: A WM_MOUSEMOVE message or mouse-button message (WM_LBUTTONUP, WM_RBUTTONDOWN, and so on).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.QS_INPUT
member.summary: An input message is in the queue.

member.summary: An input, WM_TIMER, WM_PAINT, WM_HOTKEY, or posted message is in the queue.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WAIT_OBJECT_0
member.summary: The state of the specified object is signaled.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.WAIT_TIMEOUT
member.summary: The time-out interval elapsed, and the object's state is non-signaled.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.INFINITE
member.summary: A constant used to specify an infinite waiting period, for threading methods that accept an Int32 parameter.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the non-client area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.ABM_GETTASKBARPOS
member.summary: Retrieves the bounding rectangle of the Windows task bar.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.SPI_GETWORKAREA
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the work area on the primary display monitor.

member.summary: Bottom edge.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DVASPECT_TRANSPARENT

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.DVASPECT_OPAQUE

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.HWND_TOP
member.summary: Places the window at the top of the Z order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.HWND_BOTTOM
member.summary: Places the window at the bottom of the Z order. If the hWnd parameter identifies a topmost window, the window loses its topmost status and is placed at the bottom of all other windows.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.WindowMessages.HWND_NOTOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows (that is, behind all topmost windows). This flag has no effect if the window is already a non-topmost window.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Utils.DpiAware
member.summary: Represents a class that provides support to get the current DPI value and calculate the values based on the current DPI values.

member.summary: The which is used to calculate the DPI value.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Utils.DpiAware.GetImage(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the image file from given assembly based on the DPI scaling factor. If the DPI scaling is greater than 175 then returns the high DPI image, otherwise returns the default image.
member.param: The used to read the image file.
The string contains the folder path.
The string value represents the name of the image file. The imageName must contains the extension like AddNewRowIcon.png or AddNewRowIcon.bmp
member.returns: Returns the image file from specified folder path.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Utils.DpiAware.LogicalToDeviceUnits(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts a logical DPI value to it's equivalent device unit DPI value.
member.returns: Returns the equivalent device unit DPI value.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Utils.DpiAware.GetCurrentDpi

member.summary: This is a variant of FrugalMap that always uses an array as the underlying store. This avoids the virtual method calls that are present when the store morphs through the size efficient store classes normally used. It is appropriate only when we know the store will always be populated and individual elements will be accessed in a tight loop.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Styles.ThreeObjectMap
member.summary: A simple class to handle a single object with 3 key/value pairs. The pairs are stored unsorted and uses a linear search. Performance analysis showed that this yielded better memory locality and performance than an object and an array.
member.remarks: This map inserts at the last position. Any time we add to the map we set _sorted to false. If you need to iterate through the map in sorted order you must call Sort before using GetKeyValuePair.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Styles.StyleInfoProperty
member.summary: Provides a unique identifier for a property in a style object and stores information about the associated property.
member.remarks:
is allocated once on the global heap for each property in a style object. Type safe wrappers make use of StyleInfoProperty to query, set or reset specific properties.
Holds information about the property: PropertyType, Name, how to load and save its state in StyleInfoStore, attributes, etc.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Styles.StyleInfoProperty.IsBrowsable

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Styles.StyleInfoProperty.IsConvertibleToBase64
member.summary: Indicates whether type information should be converted to Base64 if associated Type converter supports converting value to and from Base64. An example is a bitmap assigned to GridStyleInfo.CellValue. If IsConvertibleToBase64String is true, then the grid will convert the bitmap to a Base64 string and write out the information in the GridStyleInfo.ToString() method and also in the WriteXml method. Default is false.

member.name: E:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Styles.StyleInfoProperty.WriteXml
member.summary: Handles requests to serialize this property to an XML stream during an serialize operation of the class.
member.remarks: This event allows you to implement a different serialization mechanism if many style objects reference and share the same object, (e.g. if you assign a DataSet to several objects DataSource property). With such a scenario, you could write out an identifier and when the property is deserialized from an XML stream, you could reconstruct a reference to a data source object based on the identifier.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Styles.StyleInfoPropertyWriteXmlEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.
member.remarks:
The is used to serialize a property of a object. The WriteXml event occurs whenever a property is serialized to an XML stream during an operation of the class.
If you handle this event, you set to True. Handling this event allows you to customize the way the object is serialized or skip serialization.
This event allows you to implement a different serialization mechanism if many style objects reference and share the same object, (e.g. if you assign a DataSet to several objects' DataSource property). With such a scenario, you could write out a identifier and when the property is deserialized from an XML stream, you could reconstruct a reference to a data source object based on the identifier.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.Styles.StyleInfoPropertyReadXmlEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the event.
member.remarks:
The is used to deserialize a property of a object. The ReadXml event occurs whenever a property is deserialized from an XML stream during an operation of the class.
If you handle this event, you set to True. Call SetValue of the to save the value for this property into the style object. Handling this event allows you to customize the way the object is deserialized or skip serialization.
This event allows you to implement a different serialization mechanism if many style objects reference and share the same object, (e.g. if you assign a DataSet to several objects DataSource property). With such a scenario, you could write out an identifier and when the property is deserialized from an XML stream you could reconstruct a reference to a data source object based on the identifier.
